ai.summary: A short, family‑friendly coastal loop of 2.4 km that circles a lighthouse, offering sea views and a light, easy route suitable for beginners.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat coastal path with a mix of gravel, boardwalk segments, and occasional gentle steps near the lighthouse. Expect sea spray and possible damp or uneven surfaces.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and tide conditions before you go. Stay on marked paths and away from cliff edges. Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers with a waterproof outer layer. Bring water, snacks, and a charged phone. Keep children within sight at all times. In high winds or rough seas, consider postponing. Mobile coverage may be limited in remote sections.
recommended_gear: Map or offline GPS and a charged phone
Compact rain cover or bag protection
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October); milder weather and longer daylight hours, though the hike is possible year-round with proper gear.
